name: Mercury
summary: Mercury is the closest solar planet in the solar system, the smallest of the terrestrial planets. Named after the ancient Roman god of trade - fast Mercury, as it moves across the sky faster than other planets.

name: Venus
summary: Venus is the second most distant planet in the solar system, along with Mercury, Earth and Mars, belonging to the family of terrestrial planets. For a number of characteristics - for example, in mass and size - Venus is considered the "sister" of the Earth.

name: Earth
summary: The Earth is the third planet in the solar system in terms of distance from the Sun. The densest, the fifth in diameter and mass among all the planets and the largest among the terrestrial planets, which also includes Mercury, Venus and Mars

name: Mars
summary: Mars is the fourth in terms of distance from the Sun and the seventh largest planet in the solar system; the mass of the planet is 10.7% of the mass of the Earth. Named after Mars - the ancient Roman god of war, corresponding to the ancient Greek Ares

name: Jupiter
summary: Jupiter is the fifth planet from the Sun and the largest in the Solar System. It is a gas giant with a mass a thousand times that of the Sun, but two and a half times that of all other planets in the solar system combined.

name: Saturn
summary: Saturn is the sixth planet from the Sun and the second largest planet in the Solar System after Jupiter. Saturn, as well as Jupiter, Uranus and Neptune, are classified as giant planets. Saturn is named after the Roman god of agriculture. Saturn symbol - sickle.

name: Uranus
summary: Uranus is a planet in the solar system, the seventh in terms of distance from the Sun, third in diameter and fourth in mass. It was discovered in 1781 by the English astronomer William Herschel and named after the Greek god of the sky, Uranus. Uranus became the first planet discovered in modern times using a telescope.

name: Neptune
summary: Neptune is the eighth and farthest planet in the solar system from Earth. It is in fourth place in diameter, and in third place in weight. The mass of Neptune is 17.2 times, and the diameter of the equator is 3.9 times that of Earth. The planet was named after the Roman god of the seas.
